title.rendered: Petition to remove Amber Heard from Aquaman sequel gets 3 million signatures

content.rendered:
More than three million people have signed a petition to remove actress Amber Heard from Aquaman 2. It is reported by the Daily Mail.

The release of the tape will take place in March 2023. The filming of the sequel has already been completed, so the complete removal of scenes involving Heard is hardly possible. In the film, she plays the role of Queen Mera, the closest associate of Aquaman (Jason Momoa).

This week, the actress is preparing to testify in a libel case against ex-husband Johnny Depp. Just a couple of days before the hearing, Heard unexpectedly fired her PR manager. This happened after the testimony of an expert psychologist, who confirmed that Heard had borderline and hysterical personality disorders.

Depp claims Heard slandered him in a 2018 Washington Post column. In the text, she indicated that she was subjected to constant physical and emotional abuse by the actor. According to Amber, Depp also tried in every possible way to destroy her career in Hollywood.

At the same time, one of the witnesses in the case, who works for the American Civil Liberties Union, claims that the article in The Washington Post was part of the advertising campaign for the first Aquaman and brought Hurd benefits.
